thread.title: U.N. Is Sending 62 Percent of All Refugee Referrals to the U.S.
thread.title_full: U.N. Is Sending 62 Percent of All Refugee Referrals to the U.S.

author: K. Campbell
title: U.N. Is Sending 62 Percent of All Refugee Referrals to the U.S.
text:
Hungarian Leader: Trump Will Be Good for Europe and the World 
In comparison, Australia only received 9,321 referrals, while Norway received 3,806, and the United Kingdom 3,622. 
Not only was the U.S. being given the most referrals for refugees, but the total number of refugees submitted for resettlement had also reached all-time highs. 
In fact, the 134,044 refugees the UNHCR submitted in 2015 was the highest level in a single year until 2016 surpassed it, adding nearly 10,000 new cases.   
The number of annual UNHCR submissions had grown a whopping 79 percent in just four years since 2012, when 74,840 refugees were recommended for resettlement. 
"The United States is the biggest donor to UNHCR + provides the largest no of resettlement places" @RefugeesChief Filippo Grandi #ExCom2016 pic.twitter.com/bEhsHwBsAN 
â€” UNHCR Washington (@UNHCRdc) October 11, 2016 
And, while the nations who received these referrals are not necessarily required to accept the refugee, the vast majority of cases have been approved, The Daily Caller reported .
